text: Within the celestial palace of jade and gold lie infinite treasures. Yet, the Dragon Emperor’s greatest treasures are for the common people.
In lands of plenty, farmers still starve.
Every grain of rice in the dish comes from hard toil.
Proper boundaries and diligent care yield fertile lands.
All fertile black soil requires careful tending for prosperity through the ages.
Five days make a climate, three climates form a phase, six phases a season, and four seasons a year.
Strong chains and sturdy cages are essential for beast training.
Dense forests are fraught with danger, yielding fierce and untamed beasts.
Unique beasts gather here, attracting countless visitors and merchants.
Hard and soft tactics alike can bring down tigers and yoke dragons.
Study and utilize mythical beasts from across the realms.
Youth passes quickly; cherish each moment for study.
Regret for wasted youth comes too late in old age.
Aspire for greatness and diligently study the Five Classics.
A peasant today, a minister tomorrow. Greatness comes from effort.
What once graced the halls of nobility now enriches common lives.
Pity the nameless souls, dreams of loved ones fading.
Though names are lost, their deeds endure for eternity.
Early exposure to great achievements shapes noble character.
In every hill lies a loyal bone; no need for a shroud of honor.
Corruption cannot be atoned by incense; virtue needs no bow.
A dust cloud rises, a maiden smiles; no one knows the lychee’s journey.
Cool tea and hot water drive away heat and cold; cures all ailments.
Talisman water and pills dispel evils and illnesses; though simple, it shelters travelers.
Observe, ask, hear, and feel—the pillars of medicine.
Managed by provincial officials to prevent plague spread.
The imperial medics are masters of rejuvenation, students of the Moon Empress.
Those dressed in silk rarely know the toil of raising silkworms.
The sound of weaving looms is absent, replaced by sighs.
Each year, golden threads are woven, yet for others’ weddings.
Léi Zǔ cultivated silkworms and created intricate embroidery.
The jade river cleans fine silk, clothing the world in beauty.
Where neighboring settlements meet, markets flourish for common trade.
Mortgages and loans ease urgent needs; wealth grows wealth.
Wealthy traders gather, dictating local markets.
Those who transact here rival nations in wealth.
Backed by the nation, treasure notes gather funds and distribute goods.
Communities store grains and cloth for emergencies; a survival tradition for ages.
Guilds across the nation provide deposit and retrieval services.
Vast reserves of grain within strongholds ensure survival during crises.
The bastion's warehouse contains countless resources for emergencies.
How grand to build homes for all, providing shelter and joy for everyone.
Travelers rest in the shade, enjoying sweet wine to ease their journey.
Traveling merchants lodge and refresh before continuing their ventures.
Prosperous trading hubs demand numerous inns to meet needs.
Lodging for officials on duty; reserved for wealthy merchants during peace.
Opulently decorated to host esteemed visitors, showcasing the empire's might.
Disputes are resolved in ancestral halls by local elders.
Constables patrol streets and hunt bandits in the forests.
Contracts and loans are notarized, archived, and enforced by law.
Receives lawsuits, clarifies cases, and sentences criminals for peace.
Impartial and incorruptible, the court upholds justice and righteousness.
Beast Garden of Mountains and Seas
Here, animals are traded. Some become beloved pets of the wealthy, while others turn into rare delicacies.
Ferocious beasts clash in blood-pumping battles, drawing bold and valiant warriors eager to test their mettle.
On the rocky cliffs of Gray Mountain, giant eagles and flying steeds roost, while tigers and bears roar through the forests.
Exotic creatures from across the seas graze within this garden, where divine beasts are reared with untamed ferocity.
Within the Jade Blossom Stables, dragons return, and before the Golden Millet Mound, phoenixes call.
Red cinnabar can make utensils pleasing to the eye.
The sap of lacquer trees produces exquisite garments without harmful toxins.
One rain nourishes the vibrant dye trade, bringing color to new garments across the land.
Man-made rainbows leap over rooftops, spreading vivid hues throughout the realm.
Here, the skies are cleansed and imbued with hues that dye the heavens.
Hunting in the deep mountains is perilous, but this shelter offers a brief respite.
Animal pelts are highly valuable, providing a livelihood for many hunters.
Whenever great beasts appear, the Hunter’s Guild shares reports and bounties, attracting hunters of all races.
This area is home to dangerous divine beasts. Only famed hunters or state forces are permitted entry to avoid needless deaths.
In ancient times, emperors hunted in all seasons to demonstrate martial prowess. In these troubled times, such hunts serve as exercises in readiness.
If stones infused with magic are found, fortune and covetous eyes will soon follow.
Inside the mines, colorful lights intertwine in strange and dazzling patterns.
Merchants gamble on raw stones, with some becoming overnight successes.
The treasury is piled with dazzling gems, irresistible to sorcerers.
Jade, a divine material, symbolizes the virtues of a gentleman: warm, smooth, and radiant.
Through countless sieves, true gold is found.
Searching upstream for gold can reveal hidden veins.
Gold and silver ornaments are crafted with extraordinary skill.
The gold exchange houses noble elites, rivaling the wealth of entire nations.
Purest gold is offered to the emperor, while lesser gold is minted into coins.
Under the red sun, yellow earth steams, and black sand melts into white metal.
The sharpest blades are born from the earth's hardest soils.
Iron dragons lie dormant in the mountains, awaiting the call of war.
Metal clangs resonate crisply, as long forging turns iron into steel.
Hardened steel, tempered countless times, transforms into flexible strength.
Poachers and smugglers deal in illicit trade.
Black markets flourish, making authenticity hard to discern.
Legitimate sources provide ivory for auction.
The teeth of mythical beasts are crafted into fine utensils.
As hard as dragon teeth, ivory can also be intricately carved.
In quarry pits, ropes saw through stone, digging deep for quality materials.
Jade marble, radiant and elegant, adorns pillars and platforms.
Ropes and water erode stone, balancing strength and flexibility for durability.
Massive rocks are precisely carved and patterned, building the Great Bastion.
The ingenuity of the Mohists is revealed through mechanical marvels and stone craftsmanship.
The people of Cathay have experimented with herbs since the time of Shen Nong, mastering remedies for illnesses.
This fertile ground produces abundant plant life, including rare medicinal herbs.
Blessed by favorable geomancy, rare herbs thrive under careful cultivation by local authorities.
Royal elixirs can extend life and even restore the dead to vitality.
Even the moon goddess might regret stealing immortality, as she gazes nightly upon the Jade Sea.
Obsidian, infused with magic, is often seen as ominous by the common folk.
The mine sustains its workers with food to prevent night blindness.
In the mine’s depths, even torches fail to reveal the way.
If there is an underworld, this chasm would surely lead there.
The deep abyss of the earth is dark and unfathomable, rivaled only by the depths of human ambition.
The sky stretches endlessly, and the plains are vast; the wind brushes the grass, revealing cattle and sheep.
A shepherd plays a flute atop an old ox, as the melodies of folk songs echo through the land.
If compassion equals meat, the pens may still seem too narrow.
On peaceful days, cattle and sheep roam freely, providing abundant feasts for countless households.
The golden pastures yield thriving livestock, enhancing the prestige of mighty steeds.
The tender cuts of livestock grace imperial feasts, though one should not forget their indulgent excess.
Rivers leave behind clay deposits, which are refined and fired in kilns to bring wealth.
With a slow bellows and long-burning fire, soft clay transforms into sturdy pottery.
Famed ceramics are exported far and wide; opening the kiln signals a journey ahead.
Light yet strong, white porcelain surpasses snow in beauty.
Kaolin clay, fired to resemble jade, serves the imperial court, genuine in spirit.
Salty springs in the wild are sources of precious minerals, naturally formed under the sun and wind.
Though seawater is briny, evaporation and boiling yield pure salt.
Pristine salt fields produce fine salt naturally, without the need for boiling.
Imperial salt is exclusively state-controlled, ensuring stability and public trust.
White crystals, gifts from the Jade Sea, remind one of turning seas into fertile land.
Dried tangerine peel and ginger are staples for flavoring, enhancing dishes with a perfect balance.
Common spices attract foreign merchants eager to trade.
Spices grown in estates have unique flavors, cultivated with care.
Large spice estates join forces, dictating market prices with ease.
This city is renowned among traders for its aromatic Far Eastern spices.
Fresh fruits spoil quickly, but when turned into wine, they yield great profit.
Private brewers store their wine underground, releasing fragrances that waft for miles upon uncorking.
Wine merchants offer a dazzling array of vintages, satisfying travelers of all cultures.
Wine production has grown extensively, with most being exported beyond the mountains.
Every detail, from the barrels to the cellar temperature, is meticulously managed, awaiting a moment to astound.
Forests provide timber essential for building, as they have since ancient times in Cathay.
Like water carving through wood, the gentle force of sawmills splits even the hardest logs.
Lumberjacks understand the balance of replanting and harvesting to avoid overuse.
Ancient trees abound, and Cathay’s managed forests yield abundant quality timber.
A dreamlike realm, filled with jade trees and ethereal branches, evokes the heavens.
Peasant farmers often live in clusters near rice fields, with a small shrine possibly built at the village center.
Villages in Cathay adhere to the laws of the Dragon Emperor's realm, obeying imperial officials. Though mainly composed of farmhouses, some villages also host government offices.
The moonlit river reflects the sound of countless households washing clothes.
The capitals of Cathay's provinces are hubs of commerce within towering walls, bustling with traffic by day and glowing with lights by night.

Under the divine authority of the Dragon Gods, these grand cities lead all provinces. Amid a sea of lesser towns, palaces and wonders abound, industries thrive, and from high vantage points, one can marvel at the countless lights of a prosperous realm.
The Great Bastion has endured centuries of storms, providing shelter for borderland settlers and military families. Occasionally, disgraced nobles also settle here with their kin.
Increased demand has attracted merchants and artisans to settle here, fostering diverse trades.
Several garrisons share each fortress along the Great Bastion, where troops are stationed, and hundreds of patrols are dispatched to secure the wall.
Guarding Cathay’s borders is a matter of great honor, with frontier exploits often leading to elevation to the imperial court.

This mighty fortress has grown into a sprawling metropolis. Surrounding towns flourish as vibrant hubs, rivaling inland provincial capitals. Countless Cathayan elites are gathered here, awaiting the command to march north, conquer the deserts, and bring enduring peace to the realm.
This section of the Great Bastion lies in ruins, awaiting skilled Cathayan artisans to restore it.
A gathering place for the Wild Hunt, known intimately by its hunters.
The path of the Wild Hunt is known to few but is a sacred tenet for the followers of Kurnous.
The feral cavalry are otherworldly and solemn, striking down foes in the name of the lord of forests and beasts.
Arcane winds swirl into wild gales, revealing majestic and untamed beasts within the dense forests, embodying the spirit of nature.
The craftsmen of Nan-Gau, skilled in gunpowder, have gathered here, forming a renowned workshop over time.
The development of gunpowder has driven the military's demand for more powerful weapons, spurring innovation in equipment design.
Nan-Gau takes pride in its gunpowder, with artisans crafting powerful explosives in its dedicated factories.
